meanings.definition: Of or relating to fields or agriculture.
meanings.sent1: The farmer planted arval crops in the fertile soil.
meanings.sent2: The arval land was perfect for growing wheat and corn.
meanings.sent3: The arval fields whispered in the gentle breeze, telling stories of growth and harvest.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was an arval landscape, fertile with ideas waiting to bloom.
meanings.sent5: The scent of arval earth filled the air, promising a bountiful harvest.

meanings.definition: A Roman festival for the propitiation of the spirits of the dead.
meanings.sent1: During the arval, families honored their ancestors with offerings of food and wine.
meanings.sent2: The arval was a solemn occasion to remember and respect those who had passed.
meanings.sent3: At the arval feast, the spirits of the dead were said to join the living for a night of celebration.
meanings.sent4: The arval lanterns flickered in the darkness, guiding the spirits back to the realm of the dead.
meanings.sent5: The arval rituals were a bridge between the world of the living and the realm of the departed.
